title: Around the Districts : Banteer , Ballyhea and Kilbrin

Around the Districts: Banteer, Ballyhea and Kilbrin
BALLYHEA
Church Notes
Mass Times – Thursday, January 30, 10 a.m.; Friday, January 31, 10 a.m.; Saturday, February 1, 10 a.m. and 7.30 p.m.; Sunday, February 2, 8.30 a.m. and 11 a.m.
Adoration and Benediction of the Blessed Sacrament will take place on Thursday after 10 a.m. Mass.
Feastdays for the coming week – Thursday, January 30, St Aiden of Ferns; Friday, January 31, St John Bosco; Saturday, February 1, St Brigid, second patron of Ireland; Sunday, February 2, The Presentation of the Lord.
New Crucifix – The parish has acquired a large out-door Crucifix from the Redemptorist Monastery in Esker, Co. Galway.
To defray the purchase and transport costs a subscription list is now open for anyone who would like to support this initiative. Subscriptions may be left into the sacristy at any time.
Collectors for January – 7.30 p.m. Vigil Mass: Kay O’Mahony. 8.30 a.m. Mass: Phil Ryan. 11 a.m. Mass: Donie O’Sullivan.
Readers – Saturday, February 1: Louisa Carroll. Sunday, February 2: Audrey Morrissey. Saturday, February 8: Elizabeth Ryan. Sunday, February 9: Mary Byrne.
Church Altar Flower Arrangers – Saturday, February 2, and Saturday, February 9: Ann O’Brien.
Pilgrimage to Medjugorje – Leaving Cork on August 20 to September 4. Early booking offers available. Money can be paid in instalments to spread out the cost. For more information, please contact Mary Cott, Group Leader 086 1220850.
Parent and Toddler Group
The parent and Toddler Group in Ballyhea is now meeting Friday mornings from 10 a.m. to midday in the Parish Hall. Coffee and tea is provided. €3 donation please.
GAA club news
Lotto – The numbers drawn on January 18 were 14, 25, 30. There was no winner of the jackpot of €1,300. Lucky tips winners: €30 Bridget O’Sullivan c/o Tadhg Mortell, €30 Liam O’Shea c/o Ger O’Shea, €30 Helen Morrissey c/o Costcutter Ballyhea.
Get your tickets before 5 p.m. on Saturday from Costcutters Ballyhea, Corbett Court, The Idle Hour or from any of the ticket sellers or they can be purchased online at play.clubforce.com/play_newa.asp?ll_id=199#Anchor
BANTEER
weekend of success for Banteer Macra
It was a jam-packed and exciting weekend for Banteer Macra, with our members making waves on both the national and regional stages.
On Friday night, Stephen Murphy took center stage as he won the Avondhu regional round of Titles. Stephen now advances to represent Avondhu Macra at the national competition Mr. Personality in Kilkenny from April 25th to 27th. We encourage all our members and supporters to come along and cheer him on–let’s get a big crowd together to show our support for Stephen and make it a weekend to remember!
Saturday brought even more success as our talented debating team, made up of John Cashman, Amanda O’Sullivan, Colette Crowley, and Joseph Murphy, secured their place in the National Senior Debating Semi-Finals. In a thrilling quarter-final showdown, they triumphed over Callan Macra–a remarkable achievement! A special congratulations to John Cashman, who was named Best Speaker on the evening, further highlighting the team’s strength and dedication. We wish them the very best of luck as they now set their sights on the semi-finals, which will take place in Buttevant.
To round off the weekend, huge congratulations to our women’s soccer team, who put in an impressive performance at the National Finals in Dublin. The team finished second in their group, narrowly missing out on a semi-final spot by just one goal on goal difference. They can hold their heads high after a valiant effort, with their only defeat coming at the hands of group winners Roscommon—who went on to be crowned All-Ireland champions in Santry.
Well done to all involved, and as always, thank you to our supporters for cheering us on every step of the way!
Charity walk/run
Please suppoprt the Cliona Foundation charity fundraiser by Megan Withers and Kate Healy - a 5km walk/run on Monday 3rd February. Registration 10.35am at Banteer Community Centre – race starts at 11am. Registration and start at Banteer Community Centre –entry €5 or €10 for family. Please support.
Glen Theatre events
Sunday 2nd February: Join Sandy Kelly and very special guest Marc Roberts for a very special intimate evening of new songs, old song’s and life stories
Wednesday 5th February: The Special Consensus is a bluegrass band that has achieved a contemporary sound in over four decades of performing, making their music a modern classic. Band leader and founder Greg Cahill is a recipient of the prestigious Distinguished Achievement Award from the International Bluegrass Music Association (IBMA).
Saturday 8th March: Reggie from the Blackrock Road is on the case with his Masters in Irish Mortification
All shows 8pm - booking 029 56239.
Community Text Alert scheme
Text alert money €10 due for 2025 please pay by end of March to your local Comm Council members -note nonpayment will mean you will no longer get Comm Alert texts. Please forward €10 to either Norah O Riordan Nadd, Eleanor Duggan ,Denis Withers ,Mary Cahill or John Buckley.
Banteer Bingo
Bingo is played at Banteer Community Centre on Tuesday nights at 8.30pm, playing for jackpot of €4,100. Looking forward to seeing everyone.
Adult Badminton
Adult Badminton is back for the season in Banteer community centre on Monday from 8-9.30pm. All welcome. New players welcome of all abilities.
KILBRIN
Quote of the week
“Remember, after the storm passes you’ll walk out stronger.”
Blessing of throats/candles
Next Sunday February 2nd at 10am mass in Kilbrin Fr. Leader PP will do the Blessing of the throats, also the blessing of candles for home and church use will take place. Fr. Leader would appreciate donations of candles for the altar. Thank you in advance.
Community Centre renovations
The final stages of the renovations at Kilbrin sports and social club are in way. There is a full revamp on the ladies and gents toilets and we are hoping to have these completed in the coming weeks.
Kilbrin Community Council & community volunteers have put huge time and effort into this planning and organising voluntarily.
We thank and appreciate very much this effort and the patience of our customers during these renovations.
Thank You
It’s always difficult to name people individually that contribute on a voluntary basis in a community.
However on this occasion, we would like to mention one volunteer who goes above and beyond–Pat O’Leary.
Pat has dedicated the last 12 months gathering photos and memories from the community and past events to display in the social club.
She gave countless hours to reorganising, reprinting and reframing some current & new displays.
This has lead to wonderfully coordinated display of pictures and memories for all customers of the sports and social club to enjoy.
Passion for your own community is one of the many likeable characteristics that Pat displays.
She has been an active member of the community council, badminton, village renewal, Foroige and the fairy grove in her years here in Kilbrin and continues to give endless hours of voluntary work to her community and deserves the highest of praise and recognition for this.
A huge thank you to Pat from everyone for all you have given your community.
Darts
Last Friday 24th January Plate semi final 2nd leg v Hannah Griffin’s away. The result was a draw on the night 4-4 but unfortunately the boys lost 9-7 overall.
Singles games results: John Cullinane 3-1; Paddy McMahon 3-1; Shane Crowley 0-3; William Heffernan 0-3; Alan Ballentyne 3-1; Dave Griffin 1-3.
Doubles games results: Alan Ballentyne/John Cullinane 0-3; Paddy McMahon/Shane Crowley 3-2.
Next week in the league the boys are up against O’Neills in Buttevant. Wishing you all the very best of luck as always.
Foroige
Foroige will continue every Friday night from 7.30 to 9pm in Kilbrin Social Club. This is a safe environment for young people to meet and have fun together. Anyone from 12-17 is welcome to join! Next meeting this Friday 24th January.Don’t forget your €2!! Bingo
Bingo is played every Monday night in the Kilbrin Social Club at 8.30 sharp. Tea, coffee, sweets and treats and bar refreshments available. A Lovely warm comfortable environment to be in for these cold winter evenings. Jackpot is €1,200 @ 47 calls. Thank you to all that support week in and week out. It is much appreciated.
Community Grants
The Local Enhancement Grant is available for us to apply for this year so this is YOUR chance to put your ideas and thoughts forward to improve facilities and enhance our local area.
Closing date is 17th February. Please email us kilbrincc@gmail.com . We welcome everybody’s input.
This is your chance to give some feedback on what we need for our community. These grants are a fantastic way to make our community better.
Funding will support groups, particularly in disadvantaged areas to carry out necessary repairs and improvements to their facilities, purchase equipment such as tables and chairs, tools and signage, laptops and printers, lawnmowers, canopies and training equipment etc.
We already have some responses from our Foroige, Pickleball, Tir na Nog and Village renewal for funding requests.
Pickleball
Pickleball continues every Thursday from 8pm in the Social Club Hall.. we always welcome current and new members to this fun and exciting new sport!
National Spring Clean
We invite everyone in the community to join us on 5th April for our annual spring clean. Last year was a huge success so we are hoping this year will be bigger and better. Refreshments afterwards in the Social Club for all the amazing volunteers. More details to follow..
Community Council
The next Community Council meeting will be held on Tuesday 11th February at 9pm in the hall.
As the AGM is coming up soon this is the ideal opportunity for you to come along to hear what’s happening in your community and give any ideas or feedback. NOTE; The Committee alone can only achieve so much! We would encourage people of all ages to come forward and join us. Everyone is welcome.
Clothes collection
Kilbrin National School are taking any old clothes for recycling as part of the annual parents association fundraiser. You can drop the bags of clothes to the outside toilet at the side of the sports & social club over the next few weeks. Many thanks in advance for your support.
Squash
Did you know Kilbrin sports and social is host to one of Norths corks last remaining active squash courts. Founded in 1980, This club had upwards of 50 members back in 2009 with huge juvenile interest leading to them competitive games & success.
For further information Contact: Brendan Barrett at 0872789501 or kilbrinsquashclub@gmail.com or the community page here.
GAA Notes
The Kilbrin GAA Celebratory Social takes place March 1st at 7:30pm in the Hibernian Hotel, Mallow. We will be presenting our players with their Duhallow League & Cup winners medals as well as the U21s for completing an impressive double.
We are also commemorating the 1999 Junior A & U21 teams who won the Duhallow Hurling Championship 25 years ago. Every purchased ticket will go into a draw to win an overnight stay at the hotel for the same night. Please contact Jennifer Casey or William Heffernan to purchase your tickets.
Lotto: Our lotto draw took place on Wednesday 22nd January. Numbers drawn were 2, 12, 18 and 29. There was no jackpot winner. Lucky dip winners were Tadgh Brown, Tom O Sullivan and Pat O Leary, Brendan Barrett, Torkel Nielson and Michael O Sullivan Garran na Dara.
The next draw is Wednesday 5th February for a jackpot of €5,400. Play online at https://www.lottoraiser.ie/KilbrinGAA/ We appreciate your continued support for the club.
Club Shop: Kilbrin GAA have partnered with Azzurri Sports and have opened a club shop with them. With the new season around the corner, why not check out their website for a range of leisure and training gear https://azzurri.ie/Kilbrin-GAA-Cork
We also have a club shop with O’Neills who have a range of various lewisite and training gear. Check them out here: https://www.oneills.com/shop-by-team/gaa/ireland/kilbrin-gaa.html
Social Media: Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and X (formally Twitter) and help grow our page @KibrinGAAClub. We keep you up to date with match fixtures, results club projects and local ongoings in the GAA club. You can contact us directly through all of these outlets.
Sympathy
Our condolences to the Hannon family on the passing of Christy Hannon, Ballyclough. Sympathy is also extended to Teresa Breen, her son David, daughters Angela and Susan on the passing of Joe. May their souls Rest in Peace.
Your news
All notes for inclusion in the local newspaper need to be submitted by Monday 8pm each week for publication that week. You can contact Una on 087-9286180 or oriordanu@gmail.com. I would appreciate if people would forward any relevant notes for inclusion.
Thanks to everyone who has given such positive feedback in the quality of the notes and to our team of administrators behind the scenes.
